availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Gore (Caldwell co. farmer and pvt 1st ky cav (csa))

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy B. Gore. Father of James Gore, Mary Gore, Leroy Gore, Martha Gore, Permelia Gore, Maria Gore, and Pernecia Gore. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Long Pond in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from November 20, 1861, to December 19, 1862. Signed a loyalty oath to the U. S. government on May 21, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 371B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 791.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Long Pond, p. 5.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 514.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0004.
"John Binford "Flint" Gore (1828-1899)," Find A Grave, Memorial #76977652, accessed April 20, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/76977652.
